title: The Taker of Thoughts
text:
The Taker of Thoughts

Grab its white feather, Write with its thick ink. Surrender your words till you’re not but leather, Then with empty brain you can let your head sink.
Lay it atop a down pillow, And descend to the abyss. Every thought weighs a kilo, so write them down as a list.
Body of a plucked goose, Head of a dried squid. Our success is just a ruse, For it’ll win with its black liquid.
For to enchant others the payment’s your mind, To be replaced with its inkened blots. So be content with your fate assigned, Decided upon by the taker of thoughts.
Who wrote this poem? It’s in my hand. Did it come from my dome? I don’t understand.

title: The Eyes of the Painted
text: The Eyes of the Painted

title: The Lighter of Kindling
text:
The Lighter of Kindling

With your physique you stand tall and proud, Your muscles gleaming and glistening. But it’s always the largest to be struck down, By that force of nature, lightning.
Red lines, stretch marks, Appear as your body reconfigures. Now your trunk is rough like bark, Traced over with lichtenburg figures.
Across your skin branching like a tree, Disguised as an arboreal tattoo. You know it is a key, To a power that glows Electric blue.
When it courses through you with voltage, It’ll bequeath you a mighty strength. Burning through your body in rage, To pay you’ll go to any length.
A fallen tree with cracks aflame, Those it touches become like kings. Shining bright but ultimately put to shame, For it’ll burn within you, The Lighter of Kindling.

title: The Puller of Gilded Strings
text: The Puller of Gilded Strings

title: Fallouts
text:
Fallouts
Below is a D6 list of Fallouts to be used for this mystery or when forces of “The Toll of Unmeaning” are encountered.

Town crier: You can yell a cacophony of noise dealing d6 damage in a 15ft cone in front of you.
Pig latin: Your tongues twists, transfiguring to that of a pig’s. Whilst talking you can decide who does and does not understand your speech. Roll 3d6, ff the total is higher than your current max STR, take the new result.
Tower bell: Your heart takes on the form and noise of a deep bell. The warm sound helps keep outer forces from encroaching into your body. Gain 1d4 max CTRL.
Bell fried: When you hear the word bell you become frozen in place. To move/act you must repeat the word “bell” 7 times.
Gong master: Your dominant hand turns to rubber whilst the forearm turns to wood, perfect to ring a gong/bell with. Your gong arm deals d6 damage.
A random Legacy fallout

title: Poem
text:
Please read this poem of flosculations, Upon this kalotypography. Experience apanthropinization, To inhabit its lost artigraphy.
Displaced through summotion, It pealed against eveniance. Taken by tollation, Transported in a grand gardeviance.
Now its voice no different to crocitations, Never completing its archiloquy. For to all that hear its blaterations, They will always be deaf to its tortiloquy.
Yet, its form interests the campanologists, And they toll the bell to desarcinate. So they turn into phlyarologists, And all at once are unable to obacerate.
Its echoed pain only brings it amarulence, So they’re silenced with a guillotining. Its voice is long dead, ringing in a graviloquence, And so the bell chimes, the Toll of unmeaning.

title: Poem
text:

title: Locations
text:
To start the mystery “Issy” brings the investigators to the “The Old Bell”. She will answer questions but remain at The Old Bell.










An old metal bell hangs off a tree with a thick rusted chain. Below the bell are seven concentric rings like ripples in the dirt. 6 sets of footprint leading away from the bell scar the once perfect circles.

Ringing the bell causes 2 effects:

Those who ring the bell suffer 1 stress per ring.
The ringer chooses a location (sticky note) without any investigators. This location is removed and added back to the random pool.

The Bell Ritual must be accomplished here.
Rotary Phone Head will not hunt here








In this mystery there are East and West locations.
The investigators will start by investigating the East Locations. Once they have discovered all the East locations they will discover the Gilbury bridge that leads to the West locations.
The exits of East locations cannot be used to move directly to West locations. The exits of West locations cannot be used to move directly to East locations.
When investigators try to use an exit and there are no valid locations left in the pool, or the connection is invalid (i.e. a East location to a West location) they do not move normally. Instead, the Investigators move to a random valid location with an empty exit and they each suffer one stress. The 2 exits become connected.



The 10 east locations are “A locations” and so are included within the sticky pool at the start of this sticky crawl.
The focus of this mystery in on the investigator’s interactions with The Guillotined. Therefore, the descriptions of the locations are deliberately sparse. The facilitator is free to expand these in prep or during play.
East locations cannot directly connect to West locations. The East and West are only connected by Gilbury bridge.










The smell of heather envelopes the area giving a homely vibe.

Those that rest here heal 1 lost CTRL (max once). After the rest the investigator can no longer smell heather.















The herbs have been taken over by red, purple, yellow, and white poppies.

Those who haphazardly walk through will find themselves falling asleep (STR save to avoid sleep).
If there are no awake investigators to watch/help the investigator will have one of their items stolen by Rotary Phone Head if they are alive and have been activated.















The ground is covered in purple irises.

Slowly they will turn to follow the investigators.
Each investigator will get the strong urge to deeply look at them. Those who do make a CTRL save.

Those who failed will have their vision reversed, where their iris looks into their eye instead of out of their eye (1d4 dex damage).
Their vision will mostly return to normal once they leave the iris garden.
















A large open space with scatterings of trees. The normal stars and moon of the night sky are invisible, instead a pitch dark sky lays above.

For those who watch the sky they will hear the sound of a bell come from space.
It will ring 7 times, each time a new star appears forming a constellation in the shape of a bell (1 stress).















The sound of a screaming baby can be heard coming from the centre of the flower nursery.

The source is a fox, all its fur replaced by red petals (1d4 stress).
It will run off screaming and leave a trail of petals.
If followed you will find it being strangled by Rotary Phone Head.















The sound of a cacophonous gramophone can be heard outside and through all the halls. The inside is a large maze-like 18th century house, walls covered with portraits of individuals each head replaced by a bell.

Gramophone Head can be found in one of the rooms attempting to drink whiskey and smoke a cigar.















A lovely space for individuals with dementia to relax in the gardens.

Rotary Phone Head is waiting here, they will hide when investigators approach.
From then on Rotary phone head is activated and will stalk the investigators, attempting to ambush one when they are alone.















A solemn location where cherry blossoms petals slowly but constantly fall.

As the petal hits the ground a miniature petal origami human goes through an entire life through the period of a minute.
Once the petal human dies the petal rises back to the cherry tree to go through the cycle once more.
The first petal taken by an investigator becomes frozen in time becoming a memento with 1 stability.















A garden surrounded by large manicured yew hedges. Investigating and appreciating the griffin topped sundial is the friendly Typewriter Head.














The wood has become overgrown with thick razor sharp brambles. Only the sounds of crumbling trees can be heard.

Lone investigator’s will be ambushed by Rotary Phone Head, if alive, when they are alone here.
Investigator’s must roll a CTRL save or become separated from other investigators.








Once all the Central locations have been entered at least once use the below location as the next location to add to the map.










A massive goat guards the bridge. Below it where the road once was is a deep fast flowing river that will devour any who try to cross it, the danger is immediately obvious.

The Massive goat can surprisingly speak and will demand the toll of a rotary phone to pass.
The E exit can only lead to/from East locations.
The W exit can only lead to/from West locations.








The train line goes through this area. The train is constantly on the move, only briefly stopping at central station. Although only glimpses of the train can be seen in its steam whistle is constantly going off.
The 10 west locations are “C locations” and can only be accessed through the Gilbury bridge.
The W exit of the Gilbury bridge leads to the West locations.
East locations cannot directly connect to West locations. The East and West are only connected by Gilbury bridge.










Off in the intersection of two paths Chalkboard head can be found.














A curling boardwalk over a dreaded bog. Whispers of dead loved ones will speak in decipherable noises.

When traversing make a CTRL save.

Success: Traverse the boardwalk and they teleport to their final destination within the gardens.
Failure: d6 stress and go back to the start of Boardwalk.
















The Bog Gardens are covered in a steam mist produced by Steam Whistle Head.

It is difficult to find Steam Whistle Head as their whistles echo in the mist and the poor visibility makes navigating the bog dangerous.















Amongst the trees and plants stands out the Domesday yew. Where once a hollowed out tree stood now stands a massive yew treant.

The treant will talk and try to persuade people to come closer.
It is rooted in place but grabs anything moving within its reach, raising it to its mouth to eat.
It will not chew, instead only swallowing.
Soon the unlucky morsel will fall out the bottom of the treant suffering d6 damage and the treant will be satisfied momentarily.















Static washes through the area as CRT TV Head looks over the pond. Moths buzz around their head as dragonflies fly in and out of the light hunting them.














Weeping willows reflect off the mirror surface of the pond.

The branches of the trees sink into the water, they grab and attempt to drown the vain

DEX save to avoid
STR save to pull friend from willow tree’s grasp or an inventive idea.
















2 identical ponds lie at the end of a stream.

Each pond reflects the image the other pond should.
If Rotary Phone Head is still on the loose he will be easily spotted lurking in the trees through these reflections.















A collection of red leafed Nyssa surround this three way intersection.

When entering the intersection a gale picks up and the leaves envelop the investigators.
Afterwards, randomly determine which way the investigators leave.















A rock garden full of life and rocks. In the centre stands an upright log with a golden bell.

As the investigators traverse the rock garden the rocks shift and grind the trees, plants and log down into the earth.
The investigators can retreat safely or attempt to grab the bell before it is swallowed by the rocks.
To grab the bell make a DEX save

Success = Grab Golden bell (deals d6 stress to otherworld entities/monsters and the transformed (those with 3 or more fallouts))
Failure = suffer d6 damage.

If the investigators return to this location it looks like it once did before the destruction and will remain stable, but their will be no bell.















A small train station for a small steam train. When the foot wide train arrives it spits out steam and screams a whistle of pain.

Whilst driving the train, the investigator can make it stop at any West location. The train restarts once investigators have jumped off.
Jumping onto the train is dangerous due to the scalding hot steam surrounding it (d6 damage).

title: Emaciated Entities
text:
This is a website to host information on the Sticky Crawl and 7 Emaciated Entities. These materials are compatible with the Liminal Horror TTRPG.
Note: This site is a work in progress with much to add and edit.

title: Emaciated Entities
text:
Sticky crawl
The Sticky Crawl is a method to create mystery locations with the following features:

Locations are represented by sticky notes with 1-4 exits (matching the sticky note sides).
The layout of the location is organic with random sticky notes being placed as the investigators use exits.
The locations are not random, instead the “pool” of locations are bespoke to the mystery.

On top of the rules a small example Sticky Crawl is included.

title: Emaciated Entities
text:
Emaciated Entities
Additionally there are 7 Emaciated Entities included in these materials. These are once powerful entities that have been starved by the machinations of mankind. Now they prey on humans who deny these entities previous purpose.
The Emaciated entities included are:

The Lighter of Kindling
The ___
The Biter of Hands
The Eyes of the Painted
The Taker of Thoughts
The Puller of Gilded Strings
The Toll of Unmeaning

Each deity includes:

A poem
Horrors of the Entity (creature stats)
Resonant artifacts
Fallouts
A Sticky Crawl mystery

title: Emaciated Entities
text:
License
Emaciated Entities is an independent production by Matthew R. Gemmell and is not affiliated with Goblin Archives LLC. It is published under the Liminal Horror Third Party License.
Liminal Horror is copyright by Goblin Archives LLC.

title: The Bell Ritual
text:
The Bell Ritual
The ritual must be completed at The Bell to escape the gardens.
Note: Even when completing the ritual, anyone who strikes the bell suffers 1 stress per ring (one stability does negate this).
To discover the 7 steps of the ritual the investigators must track down each of The Guillotined and figure out how to communicate with them. Ensure you give the investigators the Ritual Step exactly as written below in the double quotes.

“The first step is for everyone to chant bell in unison seven times”
– The Seventh Guillotined


“The second step is for everyone to touch the ground seven times”
– CRT TV Head


“The third step is to lay seven flowers below the bell”
– Rotary Phone Head


“The fourth step is to play a heptatonic scale”
– Gramophone Head

Hepatatonic scale: Musical scale with seven notes within an octave.

“The fifth step is to recite a heptasylabillic poem”
– Typewriter Head

Heptasylabillic poem: each line of verse has seven syllables.

“The sixth step is to draw 7 concentric rings below the bell”
– Chalkboard head


“The seventh step is for the bell to be rung seven times.”
– Steam Whistle Head

title: Prelude
text:
Prelude
The below is a prelude that can be recitted to the players at the start of the mystery.

An individual leads six others to a tree silhouetted by the setting sun. As she leads them she talks away her nerves. The six only look ahead hearing her words not with meaning but as senseless noise. Nevertheless she continues to create sounds. They respond in kind, with grunts, huffs, and whistles.
As they reach the tree, engulfed by its shadow, they see their prize. A heavy tarnished bell hangs off a branch with a chain. The six instinctively circle it and talk and talk. Their speech, full of jargon, overlaps and quickens into a cacophony, the meaning lost to their guide. She promptly leaves, surely nothing strange will happen again. But of course something will happen again, otherwise we wouldn’t be here. And so, as she reaches the entrance of the Oxbury gardens she hears a massive unearthly gong from the bell. She brings out her phone and rings a friend, hopefully her meaning won’t be lost through the panic in her voice.

title: The Guillotined
text:
Each of The Guillotined wants to speak but they have been made undecipherable via their transformation.
The investigators need to help each of The Guillotined communicate to gather the different steps of The Ritual to appease The Bell. Suggestions of solutions are included in each stat block but of course other suitable solutions the players think of can and should work. Once the investigators have received The Ritual Step The Guillotined will become undecipherable once more.
If one of The Guillotined dies their “head” will fall off and the investigators can use it to try to decipher the ritual step. Each head knows a different ritual step.
Who were The Guillotined? That is up to you (the facilitator). They could be campanologists (bell studiers) who wanted to study the bell without knowing its paranormal nature. They could be well known paranormal researchers the investigators know. You could even ask for each player to create a NPC their investigator knows, these NPCs could then be some/all of The Guillotined.


Pocket watch and waistcoat attired human with the head of a gramophone. A record spins letting out a voracious cacophony, a keen ear may hear a reversed voice. They are a hot headed individual who is angered by those who don’t listen.
STR: 10 DEX: 12 CTRL: 6 HP: 4
Vinyl discus (d6)

Special ability: Post deciphered the gramophone will frantically speed up until it catches fire and explodes. Onlookers will be dealt d6 stress.

Possible solutions: (1) Record the noise then reverse the recording, or (2) physically spin the record in reverse.



An old decrepit human with a rotary phone for a head, the landline connecting to the back of their neck. The phone constantly rings but the receiver only provides garbled speech.  Hide and ambush loners.
STR: 6 DEX: 6 CTRL: 6 HP: 2
Phone cable (d6)

Special ability: Post deciphered they will rip off their phone head and dash away only to hunt the investigators when they least expect it.

Possible solutions: (1) Replace old phone with newer phone, or (2) repair rotary phone.



Anxious analog tech hipster turned typewriter headed monster. Their gnashing teeth now replaced by the clattering of keys.  They have become their own passion manifest, they are friendly. 
STR: 8 DEX: 10 CTRL: 14   HP: 3
Typewriter clatter (d4 stress)

Special ability: Post deciphered they will amiably follow and help the investigators. Easily stressed, when they lose CTRL and fail their CTRL save , they perform their Typewriter clatter.

Possible solutions: (1) Provide paper to type out its message, or (2) watch the keys and note the spelt out words.



Once a fitness and dance instructor they are now weighed down with the head of a heavy CRT TV. Pure static is a poor substitute for the music of their soul. Loves being the centre of attention, good boys and girls sit and watch TV.
STR: 12 DEX: 14 CTRL: 6 HP: 6
TV glow (d6 DEX)

Special ability: Post deciphered the TV will gain reception and flick rapidly through channels across the world, it will look for a reflection to watch its own face.

Possible solutions: (1) Create a makeshift antenna (metal hanger, paperclips etc) and attach into the TV, or (2) percussive maintenance, reduce its HP to 0.



Trainspotter with the head of a steam whistle. It’s whistle echoes in the fog of steam it constantly emits. It wants to see and so tries to rid itself of its steam. It cannot do this alone.
STR: 12 DEX: 6 CTRL: 10 HP: 6
Steam blast (d6, blast)

Special ability: Post deciphered will demand for train tickets from nearby individuals. Will attack those without.

Possible situations: (1) Bring onto the mini train to hear the message in the form of a train announcement, or (2) stop its production of steam so it can spot trains again.



A professor with the head of a chalkboard. It constantly scratches at its chalkboard face letting out a repulsive screech. The black board is covered in scribbles of white chalk layered one on top of each other. Trapped in their own thoughts they fight to regain their humanity.
STR: 10 DEX: 10 CTRL: 10 HP: 3
Nails on a chalkboard (d4 stress)

Special ability: Post deciphered the chalk rapidly builds up, covering their body only for them to transform into a heap of chalk powder.

Possible solutions: (1) Clean the chalkboard, (2) give them a different colour of chalk to write on their face with



The Seventh Guillotined has the first of The Ritual Steps. However there is no Seventh Guillotined yet. The next human (excluding The Guillotined) to lose all their CTRL becomes the seventh head.
Their head becomes a character sheet for an RPG game called Liminal Horror that rips into seven pieces. The Guillotined dies instantly by this. As the facilitator, write the message on the back of a character sheet and rip it into seven pieces for the players to put back together like a jigsaw piece. If a PC turned this way do it to their character sheet, with their permission. If the player does not want their character sheet ripped up or an NPC (e.g. Issy) turned into the 7th Guillotined then use a blank character sheet.

title: The Guillotined
text:
The Seventh Guillotined has the first of The Ritual Steps. However there is no Seventh Guillotined yet. The next human (excluding The Guillotined) to lose all their CTRL becomes the seventh head.
Their head becomes a character sheet for an RPG game called Liminal Horror that rips into seven pieces. The Guillotined dies instantly by this. As the facilitator, write the message on the back of a character sheet and rip it into seven pieces for the players to put back together like a jigsaw piece. If a PC turned this way do it to their character sheet, with their permission. If the player does not want their character sheet ripped up or an NPC (e.g. Issy) turned into the 7th Guillotined then use a blank character sheet.

title: Intro
text:
Intro
WIP
Something terrible has occured at Oxbury Gardens, a British garden attraction in the New Forset (South English coast). The groundskeeper of Izzy (Issabella) has recruited the investigators to help. Six individuals came to investigate the old bell, however something apparently went wrong as the groundskeeper heard an immense ringing and the 6 individuals were gone.
The sections of this mystery are:

Prelude: Narration prelude to set the scene.
The Bell ritual: The ritual the investigators must perform to escape the garden.
The Guillotined: The six changed individuals. The investigators must track them down, extract the ritual steps from them, and not become their prey.
Fallouts: The mystery specific fallouts.
Locations: The locations for this mystery’s sticky crawl.

title: The Biter of Hands
text:
The Biter of Hands

Wax pools around its form, Its light pink flesh that it hath lost. Followers surround it like a swarm, Their bodies it exhausts.
Only muscles and tendons do remain, To bite the hands of the willing. Its fleshy wax it will regain, In a perverse form of killing.
Any overworker will placate, Their bosses happy to ensnare. Money and self worth is the bait, All that leads is to a skeleton bare.
It once guarded those with spermaceti, But humans hunted them for candles. Now it eats them like spaghetti, Humans using its teeth as handles.
Two wicks at both ends of our bones, Flickering pink the vigour of man. We are forced to repay our grisly loans, To the whale, to the Biter of Hands.

title: Sticky Crawl
text:
The Sticky Crawl is a method to create mystery/adventure locations with the following features:

Locations are represented by sticky notes with 1-4 exits (matching the sticky note sides).
The layout of the locations is organic with random sticky notes being placed as the investigators use exits.
The locations of each investigator is tracked by a token (e.g. dice, meeples, coins etc.). NPCs and monsters can also be tracked by tokens. Tokens are used to show which location an entity (investigator/NPC/monster) is in but not necessarily where in the location they are.
Each location is not randomly made, instead the “pool” of locations are bespoke to the mystery.

The Sticky crawl has been designed for Liminal horror as it ties well to horrorific and liminal spaces. Of course it can be adapted and used for any system.


Why run or create a Sticky crawl instead of other methods?
Reasons include:

Sticky crawls are quick and interactive for the Facilitator and Players.

Facilitators do not need to print out a map. Instead, they draw each location on a sticky note as each location appears.
Players decide which exits to use and not to use, partially determining how the locations spread out.

Using ephemeral sticky notes intentionally encourages an art style that is easy and quick to imitate.

As someone who’s technical art skills are low it is nice to be able to make lo-fi images with purpose.





Below is a brief summary of how to carry out a Sticky Crawl as the Facilitator.


Once the investigators have entered the area set down the first location. This may be a specific starting location or randomly chosen from the initial pool of locations.
Below the facilitator has started with the entrance of the museum the mystery will take place in. There are 3 exits to other locations, the lines on the left, top, and right of the sticky note. Tokens are placed in the location for the three investigators; Adam, Axel, and Blaze.







When a group of investigators moves through an exit a location from a valid pool is added. Generally a new location is decided by rolling a dice matching the maximum number of locations in the pool.
When placing a new location:

Ensure the new location connects to the previous location via an exit.
Orient the location to keep as many exits of the new location unblocked as possible.

When randonly determining a location, if the location is not available:

Choose the next available location in descending order (e.g 6 -> 5 -> 4 -> 3 -> 2 -> 1).
If there are none available with a lower number choose the next in ascending order.
If there are no locations available the investigators cannot use the exit.

Below, Adam and Axel use the exit on the left. The facilitator has a pool of 6 locations (not including the entrance) so they roll a D6 to randomly decide which location they move to.
D6 locations:

Precambrian
Dinosaurs
Neolithic
Bronze age
Iron age
Industrial

They rolled a 2 giving them the Dinosaurs exhibit.







At the same time Blaze decided to take the top exit. The facilitator rolled a 5, the iron ages exhibit. Blaze’s player asks for the location to bend towards the others. It is near the start of the mystery so the faciltator agrees.













For one last example, Axel decides to use the top exit in the Dinosaurs exhibit. The facilitator rolls a 2, the Dinosaurs exhibit. Since the Dinosaurs exhibit is already in play the facilitator puts down the Precambrian exhibit instead (location 1).
















Investigators can move between existing locations with orthogonal adjacent exits. Two locations which are orthogonal but have 1 or less exits are not connected.
In the below example all the location have been discovered so no more free exits can be used. The locations include:

The starting location, Entrance.
The 6 main exhibits that were in the inital pool (Dinosaurs, Precambrian, Neolithic, Bronze Age, Iron Age, and Industrial).
The Security room, discovered by finding the security key and using them on a free exit.
The Big Bang exhibit which was added to the pool of available rooms after discovering the 6 main exhibits.

The locations each investigator can move into with one movement are:

Adam: The Big Bang exhibit and the Precambrian exhibit.
Axel: The Entrance and the Bronze Age exhibit.
Blaze: The Brinze Age exhibit.































Area: This is the entire area of the mystery and is composed of all the locations.
Location: A location is one sticky note representing a location separate from other locations. A location could be a room, a set of connected rooms, a building, a city, a forest, etc. The size of each location is dependant on the size of the area with each location in one area being around the same scale.
Exit: The exits are represented by lines on the sides of the sticky note location. This allow investigators to travel between locations. When travelling between two locations the locations must be touching each other’s sides and both the sides must have an exit. The cinnection between two locations can be a door, a path, a road, etc.
Pool: A pool of locations is a set of locations that can be randomly drawn from. A location on the table/in play is consdered not to be in the pool. If a location is removed from the table/play it is returned its pool.





Why doe the bell? WIP





Carcassonne by Klaus-Jürgen Wrede
Blue Prince by Dogubomb
Sticky Monsters by John Kenn Mortensen

title: Sticky Crawl
text:
Area: This is the entire area of the mystery and is composed of all the locations.
Location: A location is one sticky note representing a location separate from other locations. A location could be a room, a set of connected rooms, a building, a city, a forest, etc. The size of each location is dependant on the size of the area with each location in one area being around the same scale.
Exit: The exits are represented by lines on the sides of the sticky note location. This allow investigators to travel between locations. When travelling between two locations the locations must be touching each other’s sides and both the sides must have an exit. The cinnection between two locations can be a door, a path, a road, etc.
Pool: A pool of locations is a set of locations that can be randomly drawn from. A location on the table/in play is consdered not to be in the pool. If a location is removed from the table/play it is returned its pool.

title: Sticky Crawl
text:
Carcassonne by Klaus-Jürgen Wrede
Blue Prince by Dogubomb
Sticky Monsters by John Kenn Mortensen

title: Fallouts
text:
Fallouts
A d6 list of fallouts when investigators encounter forces related to The Taker of Thoughts.

Dissociative fugue: You are not the person you thought you were. Choose a new name, reroll your background, and reroll all optional investigator details you have. Choose one of your ability scores, roll d4 and add it to the score (max 18).
Goosed: Goose feathers sprout from your body, plucking them is painful. You are an intimidating presence whilst amongst allies. Once during each round of combat you can remove one dice, after rolling, from an enemy who attacked an ally. When you are alone with no allies your HP is 0.
Fingerprint ink: Thick ink exudes from your fingertips. It stops once it covers your prints but is excreted once more when removed through cleaning or use of the ink. Once a mystery write with the ink to predict the future or rewrite the past, doing so comes at a cost.
Chromatophores: Invisible ethereal chromatophores surround your body (clothing included). With deep focus you can make these visible and control their colour, able to be used as camouflage and possible other uses.
Expressive writing: You are constantly narrating events as they occur to you, whether on paper, out loud, or in your mind. This allows you to always self-distance yourself. +1 Stability.
Rumpelstiltskin: Write down the true full name of a person or entity. The name is expunged from all realities except from the mind of its owner. Choose one of three effects: (1) the person/entity is bound to the current place they are located, (2) the person’s/entity’s nature is known to you (teh facilitator shows the player its stat block), or (3) the person/entity suffers d12 CTRL damage.
